Stage de Julie Hardy (M2 Bioinformatique Bordeaux) 01 mars 2017 - 31 ao√ªt 2017

Curation and traceability of biological data

This project is divide into several parts.

First, all the data related to biological samples from each UTEC have been normalized.

Then, once these exhaustive listings have been obtained, the aim is to create differents templates for each type of samples

At the end samples in each template will be integrated into NoE database via an Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) solution.

Extract and transform data in one template

1. Check the type of your samples

  1. Plasmid
  2. Clinical
  3. Antibody
  4. Bacterium
  5. Cell & amibe

2. Go to scripts/Template_full/Data_inject and pick up you corresponding type 

      NB: Composition of one of file's template :
  1. Excel's file only xlsx or csv : raw files
  2. get_connection.py : return the model_header for scripts.py
  3. scripts.py : create the template final full with the data from the differents UTECs
  4. template_connection.csv : connection between the header's model and the UTEC's header
  5. template_model.xlsx : only model's header

3. Extract your header and paste in template_connection check if all the header correspond to the model header : 

  if the header is not in the file, add it in the column header model

4. Copy the column header model and paste in template_model

5. Add the name and the sheetname of your UTEC's file and run scripts.py

6. Now you got all the data merged in one template

Files

  • Data_UTEC: raw data of all the template per UTEC
  • curation_data: Pre-curation of the template
  • presentations: all the presentations
  • rapport: report, Gantt, and specification
  • scripts
  • Extract_header: scripts per UTEC to extract header and analyze with Cytoscape
  • network_file: visualization and analyze file with Cytoscape
  • Template_full:
  • Connection_Header: mapping between reference's template and UTEC's template
  • Data_inject: scripts per type of sample to inject data in reference's template
  • template_final: calculate percentage of filling per column
  • template_final_BD: refrence's template filling
